alert.note: Alert for Darlington; Florence; Marlboro (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 31 at 3:24PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Florence, Darlington and Marlboro Counties through 400 PM EDT... At 323 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Dovesville, or 10 miles north of Darlington, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Florence, Bennettsville, Hartsville, Darlington, Timmonsville, Mccoll, Lamar, Quinby, Clio, Mont Clare, Brownsville, Lydia, Darlington Raceway, Swift Creek, Cartersville, Florence Darlington Technical College Main Campus, Oats, Chavistown, Floyd and North Hartsville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 20 between mile markers 126 and 141. Interstate 95 in South Carolina near mile marker 146, and between mile markers 158 and 175. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for northeastern South Carolina.
